FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE KINEMATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary for Fowler Packing Plant #2 - 2009 5 Year Update


Introduction
This report and Risk Management Plan re-submission was prepared in compliance with the
5-year update requirement of 40 CFR Part 68. Activities conducted in the preparation of
this report included, but were not limited to, review of original registration information,
verification of longitude and latitude using U. S. Geological Survery information, Worst
Case & Alternative Case release scenarios using EPA RMPComp software, population
estimation using Landview data, review of the most recent 5-year accident history records,
and complete review of all original RMP/PHA documentation from June 1999. A modified
version of the procedures used to develop the original RMP were followed to prepare this
update.
All procedures, plans, and recommendations from the original 1999 RMP and 2004 Update  were reviewed and verified. With minor updates, it was determined that the Fowler Packing operating
procedures, accident prevention plan, and emergency response plan are current, still
effective, and complete. This facility has undergone several expansions since 1999. Where necessary the original RMP information has been corrected or appended to update the risk management program with changes to information, lists,
and contacts during the subsequent period since initial implementation.
There have been no reportable accidental releases from this facility during the past 5-year
period covered by the current RMP.

Process Information
The site is located 8 miles South of Fresno, California between Hwy 41 and Hwy 99. The
topography is generally flat and is rural, dedicated to farming with orchards and vineyards
surrounding the facility for several miles in most directions. Ambient temperatures are
seldom below freezing in the winter and summer highs are over 100 degrees F several
days each year. Winds are still during the winter and slight breezes are typical morning
and afternoon the remainder of the year.
T

he ammonia refrigeration system at Fowler Packing is of a flooded design in which liquid
ammonia is used in a metal pipe evaporator coil to cool air or water to remove field heat from fresh fruit for seasonal storage. Most ammonia containing components are with-in the building structures so the facility and refrigeration equipemnt are isolated from the public and all unauthorized personnel. The facility has 24X7 security and perimeter fencing.
Facilities requiring refrigeration include 7 Precoolers, 10 Storage Rooms, Mechanical Room, and 2 packing areas. Five screw compressors are in the North Mechanical Room and 2 in the South Mechanical room. Three evaporative condensers are located
between the mechanical rooms on structural steel support stands. One high
pressure receiver vessel is located inside the mechanical room and a secondary receiver is
located adjacent to the mechanical room under the evaporative condenser.
Suction and discharge piping is primarily located on roof areas accessible only to
authorized personnel. Room evaporator coils are located in enclosed bunkers behind one
wall in each room. Bin Rooms and the refrigerated hallway use suspended coils supported within the refrigerated space from the roof structure.

All of the system pressure vessels and equipment are protected by pressure safety relief
valves. These relief valves are piped to a water filled diffusion tank. Ammonia detection provides constant monitoring, alarms and shut down.

Refrigeration controls are programmable logic control (PLC) based with electric valve
actuators. All critical components have redundancy, fail-safe positions for power outages,
and can be operated manually if required. In the event of power failure the system design
automatically maintains safe system pressures and the system restarts automatically upon
return of power.
